intro: Preptanthe labrosa, commonly known as the broadleaf preptanthe, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its broad, ovate leaves that are typically hairy on the underside. The plant produces showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its botanical features make it a notable species in ecological studies and horticultural interest.
